p: The minimum inhibition concentrations (MIC) tests of the S. incanum were conducted with extracts that resulted in significant antimicrobial activities (with ≥7 mm inhibition zone) in the agar disc-diffusion tests. The data of our tests revealed that the MIC of the ethanol extracts ranged from 1.56 mg/mL to 50 mg/mL ( Table 4). Ahmed had reported more or less similar observations [ 41]. Further purification of the crude extract may increase the growth inhibition capacity of the extracts.
